projects.title: Charting the Present: Asian Modern & Contemporary Art
projects.description: A curated magazine archiving a collection of essays on East Asian contemporary art. The design follows a systematic approach‚Äîguided by an underlying grid system and precise margins, which lend a contemporary structure while subtly diverging from classical typographic conventions. Within this structure, each spread is designed to offer moments of visual tension and quiet surprise. The cover introduces a linear motif that echoes the internal grid, extending the system outward while alluding to the passage of time.

projects.title: Jungle Daydreaming
projects.description: A short-form digital collage exploring the intersection of motion and publication. Designed as a speculative exercise, the piece imagines an alternative future for digital reading‚Äîwhere pagination remains, but images move, loop, and distort. Natural forms and mechanical remnants collide across each spread: overgrown vehicles, outstretched limbs, and hyperreal parrots unfold in dreamlike rhythm, quietly unsettling the conventions of static editorial space.

projects.title: Where have all the lost memories gone?
projects.description: A short-form digital collage exploring dreamcore aesthetics through spatial tension and temporal compression. The piece blurs the boundary between real and rendered, evoking an eerie familiarity that lingers without resolution, like a place once visited but never fully seen.
